item.description: Hiker Rescue - Hoist Operation; INC#0614; 11:54AM; 3376 Mesa Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pQPG05; Chatsworth; LAFD Air Operations is preparing for a hoist operation for a 67yo female in fair condition with a medical concern (no trauma incurred). Firefighters attempted to reach by ground but due to the trail access, an air operation was determined to be the safest option. The 9-1-1 call was received at 11:07AM. ; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 AO2 BC15 E106 E107 E296 E305 H1 H3 H5 HA1 HA3 HA5 RA72 RA96 RH114 T105 T96; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0532; 10:43AM; 9149 W Cresta Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3tNDK0p; Beverlywood; KNOCKDOWN: 28 firefighters located and extinguished the attic fire in 21 minutes with no injuries reported. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 E261 E294 E43 E58 EM18 EM9 RA43 RA858 RA94 T61 T94; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0532; 10:22AM; 9149 W Cresta Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3tNDK0p; Beverlywood; One story, single family dwelling with moderate smoke showing from the attic. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. The truck company conducted vertical ventilation and have heavy, pressurized smoke emanating, (while interior fire attack does not have fire visible fire inside) indicating an attic fire.; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 E261 E294 E43 E58 RA43 RA858 T61 T94; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart
TEST ONLY; INC#TEST; 12:07PM; TEST ONLY; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1845; 11:20PM; 19223 W Saticoy St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3tDCKMf; Reseda; Firefighters quickly deployed hose lines and contained the fire to its unit of origin. It took 26 firefighters just 13 minutes to extinguish the flames. There was smoke damage to other units on the floor above. Firefighter-paramedics evaluated and treated four patients, and transported at least two of them to the hospital (unknown ages/genders/conditions). Thankfully, everyone escaped the building, as audible alarms could be heard from functional smoke detectors warning occupants of the danger. Cause under investigation.; FS 73; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM42 E103 E104 E273 E290 E293 E73 E87 E93 EM14 EM17 RA104 RA72 RA73 RA93 T73 T90 T93; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1845; 11:07PM; 19223 W Saticoy St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3tDCKMf; Reseda; Two-story garden-style apartment with fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 73; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E103 E104 E273 E293 E73 RA104 RA73 T73 T93; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Physical Rescue; INC#1163; 03:30PM; 19500 W Ventura Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3hKLfPV; Tarzana; Two-vehicle collision, involving a pedestrian. Minor injuries to one driver. Pedestrian was pulled from under vehicle prior to extrication tools being deployed, and transported to a local trauma center in serious condition. No building involvement (vehicle stopped short of hitting the structure). Nothing further. LAPD Inc 2742.; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E273 E73 E83 E84 E93 EM17 HR3 RA73 RA84 RA903 T73 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1053; 02:49PM; 517 S San Julian St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pKnvzT; Downtown; Firefighters located a fire on the third floor (of the four-story hotel built in 1925), being held in check by fire sprinklers. It took 48 firefighters 16 minutes to extinguish the flames. Two patients have been located and firefighter-paramedics will assess the need for treatment and transport (unknown age/gender/condition/affiliation). Cause under investigation.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E203 E209 E210 E3 E4 E9 RA25 RA803 RA809 SQ21 T10 T3 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1053; 02:33PM; 517 S San Julian St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pKnvzT; Downtown; Four-story pre-1933 center-hallway hotel with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E203 E209 E210 E3 E4 E9 RA25 RA803 RA809 SQ21 T10 T3 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Brush Fire; INC#0734; 11:37AM; EB 118 Fwy x Rocky Peak Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/36NVi10; Ventura County; LAFD responding in automatic aid to a one-quarter-acre brush fire in Ventura County (LA Co FD also responding). For more information on this incident, please monitor Ventura County FD channels. Nothing further.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District outside city; AO1 AO2 BC15 BC17 E106 E107 E28 E290 E296 E305 E73 E8 E84 E90 EM15 H1 H2 H3 HA1 HA2 HA3 RA96 T105 T90 T96; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange
